intro: Trachyspermum microcarpum, commonly known as caraway, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits called mericarps, which are used in culinary and medicinal applications. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun for optimal growth. Trachyspermum microcarpum is valued for its essential oils, which contribute to its distinctive flavor and fragrance.
